title: Hotels and Accommodation
summary: Essential vocabulary to talk about different types of accommodations and describe hotel experiences, including types of lodging and adjectives for reviews.

sections.heading: Types of Accommodation
sections.content: This section covers different places people stay when traveling.

examples.definition: A building with many rooms for travelers, varying in price and quality.
examples.example: We stayed at a luxury hotel with a spa and swimming pool.

examples.definition: Small accommodation that includes breakfast, often in someone's home.
examples.example: The cozy B&B had homemade breakfast served every morning.

examples.definition: An entire home rented out for holiday use.
examples.example: We booked a vacation rental by the beach for our family holiday.

examples.definition: Small private accommodation similar to a hotel but more personal.
examples.example: The guest house was run by a friendly local couple.

examples.definition: Staying in someone's home to experience local culture.
examples.example: My homestay in Japan included meals with the host family.

examples.definition: Hotel with recreational facilities and included amenities.
examples.example: The beach resort had three pools and five restaurants.

sections.heading: More Accommodation Types
sections.content: Additional types of lodging options for travelers.

examples.definition: Small house in nature, often with outdoor facilities.
examples.example: We rented a wooden cabin in the mountains for skiing.

examples.definition: Budget accommodation with shared dormitories.
examples.example: As students, we stayed in youth hostels to save money.

examples.definition: Hotel designed for motorists, usually with parking.
examples.example: We stopped at a roadside motel during our road trip.

sections.heading: Describing Hotels and Services
sections.content: Adjectives commonly used to describe hotel staff and services.

examples.definition: Staff who listen carefully to guests' needs.
examples.example: The attentive staff remembered our coffee preferences.

examples.definition: Not having enough employees to serve guests properly.
examples.example: The restaurant was understaffed, so service was slow.

examples.definition: Providing good service without wasting time.
examples.example: The efficient receptionist checked us in quickly.

examples.definition: Extremely clean, without any dirt.
examples.example: Our hotel room was spotless when we arrived.

examples.definition: Having plenty of room; not cramped.
examples.example: We upgraded to a spacious suite with a living area.

examples.definition: Contemporary style and facilities.
examples.example: The hotel had a modern design with smart technology.

examples.definition: Old and in poor condition.
examples.example: The armchairs in the lobby looked tatty and worn.

sections.heading: Describing Location and Value
sections.content: Vocabulary for evaluating accommodation location and pricing.

examples.definition: Located in the middle of a town or city.
examples.example: The hotel's central location was perfect for sightseeing.

examples.definition: Costing more than it's worth.
examples.example: The tiny room was overpriced for what it offered.

examples.definition: Located near useful facilities and transport.
examples.example: The hotel was convenient for the conference center.

sections.heading: Describing Food and Experience
sections.content: Vocabulary for evaluating hotel food and overall stay.

examples.definition: Extremely tasty food.
examples.example: The hotel restaurant served delicious local cuisine.

examples.definition: Lacking flavor or taste.
examples.example: The breakfast buffet looked nice but tasted bland.

examples.definition: Not as good as expected.
examples.example: Our stay was disappointing due to poor service.

examples.definition: Worth remembering for being special.
examples.example: The amazing views made our stay truly memorable.
